intro: Vaughania interrupta, commonly known as the Mexican flame tree, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of South America. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its striking orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with opposite arrangement and produces small, winged fruits that split open when mature. Vaughania interrupta is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display and adaptability to various soil types. It thrives in full sun and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
